clues.category: HAVE A HEART WITH DR. OZ
clues.clue: (Dr. Oz delivers the clue holding a real heart.)  This valve, whose name is from the Latin for "three points", prevents the backflow of blood from the right ventricle into the right atrium

clues.category: HAVE A HEART WITH DR. OZ
clues.clue: (Dr. Oz delivers the clue, again holding a squishy human heart.)  The sinoatrial node on the back wall of the right atrium, here, sends out electrical signals to regulate the heartbeat & is also known as this, like a mechanical device implanted to do the same thing

clues.category: HAVE A HEART WITH DR. OZ

clues.category: HAVE A HEART WITH DR. OZ
clues.clue: (Dr. Oz delivers the clue from his office, with some product placement on his desk.) This severe constricting pain in the chest is a symptom of coronary artery disease, but 50% of heart attack patients never experience it

clues.category: HAVE A HEART WITH DR. OZ
